6deqi6mqlqt0apbusci04gfrgo.name: SAE International Student Membership Information Session
6deqi6mqlqt0apbusci04gfrgo.description:
FREE event for engineering students and faculty: includes a technical presentation, food, prizes, and more!

Join SAE International (an association focused on mobility engineering in the automotive, aerospace, and commercial vehicle industries) to discover student and professional member benefits, plus presentations by industry experts. 

Presentations:
•	“Things You Never Heard In Engineering Class: Leveraging SAE Involvement for Career Advancement” with SAE Member Dean Case, Consultant, Motivo Engineering/Grassroots Motorsports

•	Student member benefits such as our student technical paper competition, mentor community, free Career Counselor video series to build soft skills, discounts on engineering products, and more: Amanda Hildabrand, SAE Membership Manager 

•	Information on MOBILUS, our online database of technical papers and standards: Michael Ferketic, SAE International 

The cost of a student membership is $30. You can join onsite at the event, or join now online at sae.org/join. 

Graduating? We’re giving you a graduation gift: one year of SAE professional membership for free! Find out more at this event, or email membershipteam@sae.org.

3hmoau3cobisp91sm3f43934lt.name: Kennametal Campus Tabling
3hmoau3cobisp91sm3f43934lt.description:
Kennametal was founded in 1938. Customers across aerospace, earthworks, energy, general engineering and transportation trust Kennametal’s innovations in materials science, tooling and wear-resistant solutions. Kennametal employs approximately 10,000 people around the globe serving customers in more than 60 countries. In fiscal year 2018, Kennametal reported sales of nearly 2.4 billion dollars. Experts in three business segments Industrial, Infrastructure and WIDIA work directly on the customer shop floor, at the mine face or on the construction site to solve problems and increase productivity.

https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/events/330563


EMERGE – Kennametal’s Emerging Leadership Program 
EMERGE, Kennametal’s early-career leadership development program, is focused on building emerging leaders within Kennametal through diverse experiences to expand their perspectives, develop functional expertise, and accelerate career development. 

EMERGE will equip participants with leadership, professional, and technical skills necessary to drive performance and integration among business functions. This immersive program is 2 years in duration with diverse functional rotations within Kennametal’s IT, Finance, Operations and Commercial business tracks. Participants must be willing to relocate or travel during the program. Post completion of the program, position placement will be into a role based on your strengths and interests, as well as business need at that time.

Program Tracks 
IT -Our Information Technology Team is a trusted business partner translating needs into technical solutions and protecting our assets. 
Finance -Our Finance team partners with the business every day to enable strategic decision making while delivering best-practice financial processes, measurement and execution.
Operations -Our operations team is at the heart of what we do. Focused on manufacturing, supply chain and engineering, this team helps drive the success of our three business segments.
Commercial -Our Commercial Team combines a technical and business mindset to deliver the most valuable products, solutions and know-how to our customers every day.
3hmoau3cobisp91sm3f43934lt.location: Cohon University Center, Table - Wean Commons

2v7gi90t11b9taibt1fc3cmmtk.name: Embark Trucks - Building Self Driving Trucks as a Robotics Startup, Lessons from the Open Road
2v7gi90t11b9taibt1fc3cmmtk.description:
Embark Trucks is an SF based startup building self-driving trucks for highways. We have raised 47.5 million, driven 300,000+ autonomous miles and move freight between LA and Phoenix. 

Come out to hear from a current member of our Perception team (and CMU alumni) about the work we are doing and what an internship or full-time work is like here. 

2 hours of Bay Area highway driving with 0 interventions: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5pYWhBQ7N4E

https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/events/336134

Moving freight between Texas and California: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3yPMxV11KaA

6shgcb04vbqt7sfta06bbklm5r.name: Caterpillar Information Session
6shgcb04vbqt7sfta06bbklm5r.description:
Join us for this presentation on the complex and fascinating work done by Caterpillar in the areas of electrification, hybrid, and autonomous systems. You will learn about Caterpillar’s business, career opportunities, and technologies. The presenters, former CMU students, will cover technical projects related to remote control and autonomy, hybrid energy storage, dual fuel engines and power systems. 

Caterpillar is the largest manufacturer of construction equipment, mining equipment, diesel and natural gas engine systems in the world. Cat is a Fortune 100 company with annual revenue of $55B and one of 30 in the Dow Jones Industrial Average. Cat invests heavily in research and development of new technologies. Electronics, advanced controls, and autonomous systems are key areas of investment for Caterpillar. Cat employs over 2000 electronics and software engineers worldwide and was ranked #1 as “top employer in electronics” by Electronic Design magazine. 

Today, Caterpillar’s autonomous machines operate on numerous mine sites around the world. They can negotiate complex haul roads, maneuver through high traffic areas, and work with other autonomous machines to perform complex tasks. Join us for this presentation and take a look under the hood at the technology that drives “Big Cat.”

5vlekcfvps6815uq0vaahrfboa.name: Lutron - tabling & demo 1
5vlekcfvps6815uq0vaahrfboa.description: Lutron is the worldwide leader in lighting, automated shade and temperature controls, with headquarters in Lehigh Valley, Pennsylvania and engineering offices in Boston, Philadelphia, South Florida and Austin. We are a privately held manufacturing company with over 4000 design and product patents. We are at the forefront of innovating IoT products for smart homes and connected buildings. We provide solutions for residences that span from 500 sq. ft apartments to 10,000 sq. ft homes and commercial solutions for small office spaces to entire building complexes such as the New York Times Building, Lincoln Financial Field in Philadelphia, Empire State Building and the Guggenheim Museum.

4is68fepeqgs3186d1cvq8q67j.name: Clark Construction - Information Session
4is68fepeqgs3186d1cvq8q67j.description:
Our definition of success is your success. We are committed to attracting and developing top talent to help build the world around us.

Founded in 1906, Clark Construction Group is one of the nation’s most experienced and respected providers of construction services. Clark is consistently ranked among the nation’s leading general contractors, performing more than $4 billion worth of work each year.

Our portfolio features projects of all sizes and levels of complexity — from intricate interior renovations to some of the most complex civil operations in the country; we can build it all — and we do. Clark’s breadth of capabilities ensures that we are able to meet our clients’ needs every time, on every front.

Headquartered in Bethesda, Maryland, Clark has offices strategically positioned throughout the United States.
4is68fepeqgs3186d1cvq8q67j.location: GSIA Building, Posner Hall, Room 160, CMU

46r6a5nm8efmpdmf67jlu9iat9.description: WVU Medicine is West Virginia University's affiliated health system, West Virginia's largest private employer, and a national leader in patient safety and quality. We have more than 1,000 active medical staff members and 16,000 employees that serve hundreds of thousands of people each year from throughout the state and nation, driven by an unbridled passion to provide the most advanced healthcare possible to the people of West Virginia, Appalachia, and beyond.

3dh5qp34ck3m0tatmn585gjskj.name: M.C.DEAN. Info Session
3dh5qp34ck3m0tatmn585gjskj.description:
M.C. Dean, Inc. is the nation’s premier electrical design-build and systems integration firm for complex, mission-critical organizations. M.C. Dean’s capabilities include electrical, electronic security, telecommunications, life-safety, instrumentation and control, and command and control systems. M.C. Dean serves a diverse group of markets including Fortune 1000 corporations; universities; high tech and biotech firms; Federal; state, and local government clients; and other organizations with large scale, complex, and mission-critical infrastructure needs. Established in 1949, M.C. Dean has earned a reputation as an innovator and pioneer. Headquartered in Dulles, Virginia, M.C. Dean employs more than 3,000 professionals in offices throughout the United States, Europe and the Middle East.

M.C. Dean offers an excellent benefits package including a competitive salary; medical, dental, vision, life and disability insurance; paid-time off; tuition reimbursement; 401k Retirement Plan and Military Reserve pay offset.

Applicants selected will be subject to a government security investigation and must meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information.

For more information about our company, you can visit www.mcdean.com.

1580ts5g3ehsb6741e2v5k3v9r.name: Tech Talk by John Deere - Physical meets Digital: Automation and Data Journey in Agriculture
1580ts5g3ehsb6741e2v5k3v9r.description:
Topic: Physical meets Digital: Automation and Data Journey in Agriculture

Abstract :
Agriculture is undergoing a new revolution, using information and automation to improve the productivity of farms and help feed the world’s growing population. This talk will look at how John Deere is using concepts from computer vision, machine learning, robotics and data informatics to improve productivity and provide value to our customers. We will also talk about the employment and internship opportunities available at Deere and how you can work in this exciting area.


Speaker :
Stewart Moorehead is the Enterprise Perception System Architect working at John Deere’s Global Technology Innovation Network. His work looks at how computer vision and machine learning can be used in Deere’s products to improve performance and increase safety of highly automated and autonomous vehicle systems. He has worked on autonomous tractors for orchards, robotic lawn mowers and the R Gator a robotic utility vehicle. He has a Ph.D. in Robotics from Carnegie Mellon’s Robotics Institute.

Food and refreshments will be provided.

5schqc7d7bvhf5vbecj949e66k.name: Engineering Virtual Career Fair
5schqc7d7bvhf5vbecj949e66k.description:
https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/career_fairs/12751
Career Fair Description
To register for this event please visit: https://app.brazenconnect.com/a/cmu_career/e/GK1xz

The Engineering Virtual Career Fair occurs, October 18 from 1pm - 4pm EDT.   Please note the following reminders and instructions for the event. We will be using the platform Brazen for the virtual fair https://app.brazenconnect.com/a/cmu_career/e/GK1xz .

1) Before the event starts, log-in to Brazen to update your registration page if you haven’t already (top-right corner under your name). This registration page will allow you to add a resume and other key information for employers to view. To participate, you can log in with the the same link to begin.

2) Chats with employers have been set to 10 minutes. This time goes quickly, so I recommend brainstorming a few main takeaways that you would hope to capture/share before the time expires (i.e., contact information, job titles, next-step instructions, etc.).

4) Click here and scroll down to watch a video on what to expect.

0m9ofqov6p6v9lau3m6a2krt3r.name: Information Session with the National Geospatial Intelligence Agency
0m9ofqov6p6v9lau3m6a2krt3r.description:
Interested in a job supporting the U.S. Intelligence Community? Come learn about the National Geospatial-Intelligence Agency (NGA), why it’s a great place to work, and how you may be a fit! A Recruiter, and a Hiring Manager will be on hand to discuss these items and answer your questions. Bring your resumes as we will discuss NGA's mission and the various full-time positions and internships that NGA offers.

NGA is providing full-time and internship opportunities to students from a range of majors, including Environmental Studies, History, Global Studies, Linguistics, Anthropology, Political Science, Economics, Geography, GIS, Geophysics, Biochemistry, Math, Statistics, Computer Science, Physics, Computer Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Electrical Engineering, History, Global Studies, Linguistics, Anthropology, Political Science, Economics or related disciplines. The list above is just an example of majors NGA interns have had in the past. If you do not have any of the majors above, don't fret! There are opportunities at NGA for all majors.

NGA is looking for students of all years, and are particularly interested in freshmen. Unlike many firms, we will take students very early in their college career for internships (as early as the summer after their freshman year) and each subsequent summer too if the opportunity is of interest to the student.

NGA is a unique combination of an intelligence agency and combat support agency. NGA delivers world-class geospatial-intelligence that provides a decisive advantage to policymakers, warfighters, intelligence professionals and first responders

5u67mvj3ccr0s9fo1a633uk0b7.name: Procter & Gamble (P&G) CIT Special Event
5u67mvj3ccr0s9fo1a633uk0b7.description:
This is a SPECIAL EVENT TAKING PLACE ON CAMPUS AT CARNEGIE MELLON UNIVERSITY & Opened to all CIT undergraduate students.

CMU CIT Special Presentation by Procter & Gamble (P&G)
Featuring CIT Alum Scott Whalen:
Date: Thursday Sept. 26
Time: 3pm – 4:30pm
Location: Scott Hall Room 6142
Itinerary:
3:00-3:30 “Technology Innovation Across the Supply Chain at P&G”
Beth Kushon – Vice President, Product Supply, P&G Beauty
Beth started her career with P&G in Purchasing after earning BS degrees in both Industrial Management and Psychology at Carnegie Mellon in 1990.

3:30-4:00 “Driving Environmental Sustainability at P&G through Product, Package, and Supply Chain Innovation”
Scott Whalen – Director, Global Business Development
Scott started his career with P&G in R&D after earning BS degrees in both Chemical Engineering and Economics from CMU in 1981

4:00 Open Forum/Q&A with P&G Senior Leaders
Beth Kushon – Vice President, Product Supply, P&G Beauty
Scott Whalen – Director, Global Business Development
Laura Fernandez – Associate Director, R&D, P&G Beauty

DURATION
Permanent

CONTACTS
Maureen May
Laura Fernandez
JOB FUNCTIONS
Engineering - Civil / Mechanical / Other, Engineering - Web / Software, Information Technology, Logistics & Supply Chain
PROCTER & GAMBLE (P&G)
P&G (Procter & Gamble) serves consumers around the world with one of the strongest portfolios of trusted, quality, leadership brands, including Always®, Ambi Pur®, Ariel®, Bounty®, Charmin®, Crest®, Dawn®, Downy®, Fairy®, Febreze®, Gain®, Gillette®, Head & Shoulders®, Lenor®, Olay®, Oral-B®, Pampers®, Pantene®, SK-II®, Tide®, Vicks®, and Whisper®. The P&G community includes operations in approximately 70 countries worldwide. Please visit http://www.pg.com/ for the latest news and information about P&G and its brands.

Our Purpose: We will provide branded products and services of superior quality and value that improve the lives of the world's consumers, now and for generations to come. As a result, consumers will reward us with leadership sales, profit and value creation, allowing our people, our shareholders and the communities in which we live and work to prosper.

Procter & Gamble - Improving everyday life since 1837.

2k3qtr97j6amcfofsa63g0iet0.name: ChenMed Leadership Fellow Info Session
2k3qtr97j6amcfofsa63g0iet0.description:
Heinz College:

As a company, we are making a difference in the lives of seniors and the healthcare system overall.

ChenMed brings concierge-style medicine and better health outcomes to the neediest populations – moderate-to-low income seniors with complex chronic diseases. Operating over 50 medical centers in eight states, we are known to our patients as Dedicated Senior Medical Center, Chen Senior Medical Center, or JenCare Senior Medical Center.

Through our innovative operating model, physician-led culture and empowering technology, we drive key quality and cost outcomes that create value for patients, physicians and the overall health system. By recruiting focused physicians and reducing their doctor-to-patient ratios, we increase patients’ “face time” during each monthly appointment and help foster stronger doctor-patient relationships.

Results of our high-touch approach to primary care are impressive, as illustrated in the recent Modern Healthcare cover story published on Oct. 20, 2018, which reports that: “Indeed, ChenMed's approach has resulted in 50 percent fewer hospital admissions compared with a standard primary-care practice, 28 percent lower per-member costs, and significantly higher use of evidence-based medications.”

1o55t49qgc5q4lf4dmcd77m3pb.name: L'Oreal Information Session
1o55t49qgc5q4lf4dmcd77m3pb.description:
Want to work for a company that recognizes your individuality, passion, and gives you the opportunity to contribute in meaningful ways from day one? A company devoted to building and shaping your future, that was rated as a WayUp Top 100 internship program 3 years in a row, and is a market leader in its industry with brands such as CeraVe, Maybelline, Kiehl’s, Lancôme, and Urban Decay?

L’Oréal is a global CPG (Consumer Product Goods) leader with 30+ brands making up our diverse portfolio. Our ambition for the coming years is to win over another one billion consumers around the world by creating the cosmetic, skincare, and grooming products that meet the infinite diversity of their beauty needs and desires. Since the company’s creation by a researcher, the group has been pushing the frontiers of knowledge, technology, and innovation.

With this ambition in mind, we are looking for top talent across majors to join us for our competitive Summer Internship Programs. Our interns lead strategic projects that create real business impact, so we are looking for innovators ready to tackle the growing needs of our consumers!

Come meet with the team from L’Oréal to learn more about opportunities within the company, our summer internship program, the Brandstorm Case Competition, and how L’Oréal is using technology to drive innovation.

We are recruiting current juniors for our Summer Internships in:
Marketing
IT
Finance
Human Resources
Sales & Business Development
Operations
Research & Development

1r0ujq0td7a9hhhubprkj176nm.name: SASE National Conference and STEM Career Fair 2019
1r0ujq0td7a9hhhubprkj176nm.description:
The Society of Asian Scientists and Engineers (SASE) will be hosting the largest National Conference and STEM Career Fair for Asian-Americans in the United States. The theme, Building Bridges - Connecting Leaders, exemplifies SASE's mission to be the go-to organization for talent and leadership development in science, engineering, and technology.

SASE National Conference and STEM Career Fair 2019
October 10 - 12, 2019
David L. Lawrence Convention Center, Pittsburgh, PA
www.saseconnect.org/conference

There will be over 40 workshops ranging from personal and professional development to leadership, science, and technology. New additions to the conference include an Employee Resource Group (ERG) Leadership Development that will open the conference Thursday, and an AsianUpward professional training course intended to help participants hone in on communication skills. Attendance is expected to be over 3,000 students and professionals.

On the last day of the conference, Saturday, October 12th, SASE will be hosting a free STEM career fair with over 70+ companies such as: Boeing, P&G, GE, Lockheed Martin, NASA, Shell, Northrop Grumman, and many more! With many jobs and careers available, these companies will be conducting on the spot interviews.

The conference is open to everyone and non SASE members are welcomed and encouraged to attend! The career fair is free and CMU students also get a discount on workshops when they enter the code 19CMU50!
1r0ujq0td7a9hhhubprkj176nm.location: David L. Lawrence Convention Center, 1000 Fort Duquesne Blvd, Pittsburgh, PA 15222, USA

5rqvio64fn2n8785okbcs6sjma.name: IQVIA Academy Information Session
5rqvio64fn2n8785okbcs6sjma.description:
Interested in the healthcare/life sciences sector and consulting? Come meet and chat with the IQVIA Academy!

The IQVIA Academy is a leadership development program at the forefront of IQVIA’s top strategic initiative and new business offerings. As a part of the world’s largest provider of biopharmaceutical development and commercial outsourcing services, the Academy provides consulting services to leading firms in the healthcare and pharmaceutical industries. Their practitioners work directly with clients on consulting engagements to support evolving business needs across a variety of business functions. The Academy program also offers leadership development opportunities, career progression & expansion, and exposure to senior leaders in the company. Don’t miss out on this great opportunity to interact with a current IQVIA Academy member and learn more details about the program!

4rug3a83l29c3iin69rdl0j5u6.name: SASE National Conference and STEM Career Fair 2019
4rug3a83l29c3iin69rdl0j5u6.description:
The Society of Asian Scientists and Engineers (SASE) will be hosting the largest National Conference and STEM Career Fair for Asian-Americans in the United States. The theme, Building Bridges - Connecting Leaders, exemplifies SASE's mission to be the go-to organization for talent and leadership development in science, engineering, and technology.

SASE National Conference and STEM Career Fair 2019
October 10 - 12, 2019
David L. Lawrence Convention Center, Pittsburgh, PA
www.saseconnect.org/conference

There will be over 40 workshops ranging from personal and professional development to leadership, science, and technology. New additions to the conference include an Employee Resource Group (ERG) Leadership Development that will open the conference Thursday, and an AsianUpward professional training course intended to help participants hone in on communication skills. Attendance is expected to be over 3,000 students and professionals.

On the last day of the conference, Saturday, October 12th, SASE will be hosting a free STEM career fair with over 70+ companies such as: Boeing, P&G, GE, Lockheed Martin, NASA, Shell, Northrop Grumman, and many more! With many jobs and careers available, these companies will be conducting on the spot interviews.

The conference is open to everyone and non SASE members are welcomed and encouraged to attend! The career fair is free and CMU students also get a discount on workshops when they enter the code 19CMU50!
4rug3a83l29c3iin69rdl0j5u6.location: David L. Lawrence Convention Center, 1000 Fort Duquesne Blvd, Pittsburgh, PA 15222, USA

15l4hi4r1isfo21billb0uu3ad.description: Join Lubna Owais and fellow Schneider Electric colleagues as we go live from WE19, the world's largest conference for women engineers, hosted by the Society of Women Engineers. We'll also take a tour of our Nashville Hub office. To join the fun, click the Skype link. (For audio only, call 1-844-817-4005, Passcode: 8115850#).

6h4slv7vegke8r5v7pac7e8h54.name: LERA Structural Engineers Info Session
6h4slv7vegke8r5v7pac7e8h54.description:
LERA Consulting Structural Engineers (LERA) is a structural engineering firm providing services to architects, owners, contractors, and developers. Since our founding in 1923, we have designed numerous landmark projects across the world, and established a strong reputation for design and technical excellence. Today, LERA’s talented professionals continue the tradition of creating innovative, yet constructible and economical structural designs.

Our portfolio includes a wide variety of building types of every size and level of complexity. We have accomplished unique and award-winning designs for new buildings as well as renovations to existing and historic structures. Our services include complete structural designs, feasibility studies, peer reviews, value engineering, computational design, blast analysis and design, forensic consulting, and special inspections.

Headquartered in New York City, LERA also operates offices in Mumbai, Hong Kong and Shanghai.

6pd5uf42i36trbutoqj2rb4gp2.name: TAIT Towers Information Session for All Majors
6pd5uf42i36trbutoqj2rb4gp2.description:
TAIT will be holding an information session for all majors on Tuesday, November 12th from 5-6pm in the Wells Video Studio in the Purnell Center. They are looking for students with skillsets and capabilities such as:

Staging-Engineering-Fabrication-Automation-Mechanical Design-Structural Design-Controls Design-Automated Rigging-Robotics-Integration-Performer Flying-Software

They also have career opportunities such as:

Designers-Engineers-Project Managers-Fabricators-Technicians-Welders-Painters-Machinists

TAIT is the World Market Leader in designing, constructing and delivering the finest live event solutions in the world.

Whether it’s creating awe-inspiring spectaculars, complex touring stages, theater engineering solutions, brand activations or cruise ship installations, TAIT delivers world-class solutions for live experiences. With its proprietary entertainment automation platform, custom-made products, and creative engineering, TAIT’s cutting-edge offerings continue to advance industry standards and exceed client expectations. As a global network of over 600 employees in 12 office locations, TAIT has worked on projects in over 30 countries, all 7 continents and even outer space.

TAIT’s diverse group of clients include Taylor Swift, Cirque Du Soleil, The Metropolitan Opera House, NASA, National Geographic, Beyoncé and The Olympics.

526qmioifdpg7esbqp776l7t1i.name: View - Info Sesh
526qmioifdpg7esbqp776l7t1i.description:
In the great tradition of challenging the way we think about everyday essentials, the team at View has reinvented something that hasn't changed for centuries – the simple window – and in doing so, is transforming the largest industry in the world: real estate.
We manufacture View Dynamic Glass, a new generation of smart windows that let in natural light and views and enhance mental and physical wellbeing by significantly reducing headaches, eyestrain and drowsiness. In addition, View’s windows reduce glare and heat, improving the energy efficiency of buildings by 20 percent. View’s windows are digital, cloud connected, and can be controlled from anywhere, including your phone. We are also leveraging advances in AI to develop smart building and IoT applications that make buildings healthier, smarter and more productive than anyone ever imagined.
View is already installed in over 50 million square feet and is growing rapidly. If you dream of changing the world to make it a better place – join us.

21a32pbjubevmujoc2jj1j5g2f.name: Booz Allen Hamilton - Health Team Information Session
21a32pbjubevmujoc2jj1j5g2f.description:
Heinz College Students:

Booz Allen Hamilton has been at the forefront of strategy and technology consulting for 100 years. Today, the firm provides professional services primarily to the US government in the defense, intelligence, and civil markets, and to major corporations, institutions, and not-for-profit organizations. Booz Allen offers clients deep functional knowledge spanning strategy and organization, engineering and operations, technology, and analytics—which we combine with specialized expertise in clients’ mission and domain areas to help them make their toughest decisions.

Our Civil Health team works with all major agencies at the Department of Health and Human Services (HHS), including the US Food and Drug Administration, National Institutes of Health, Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, and Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services (CMS), as well as throughout the Department of Veterans Affairs. Booz Allen offers a diverse set of career opportunities in the Health market, from policy and research analysts, IT-oriented specialists, and clinical professionals, to general management consultants. Our team members have diverse academic and professional backgrounds, and the Civil Health team looks for individuals from all backgrounds who are highly motivated, intellectually curious, interested in helping our clients achieve their missions, and work well both individually and within a team. As a Booz Allen employee, you will find the support and resources you need to learn, balance work-life integration, and be recognized for your achievements. Your ideas can take root among a talented team of thought leaders and high achievers that are dedicated to excellence, passionate about results, and committed to impact and growth.

Target Candidates
Booz Allen is currently recruiting for a small cohort of high-performing, analytically-driven, strategy and policy consultants who can be deployed across a variety of efforts in Booz Allen’s Civil Health market to solve complex problems for our clients. We are looking for committed and passionate public policy and public health professionals to join our team of general management consultants.
